summary: This is an email chain from July 9, 2019, forwarding a message regarding contact from the House Oversight Committee about the Jeffrey Epstein indictment. The forwarded message is from a Deputy Assistant Attorney General in the DOJ's Office of Legislative Affairs seeking the correct point of contact to discuss the committee's request.

persons.name: Deputy Assistant Attorney General
persons.role: Deputy Assistant Attorney General, Office of Legislative Affairs, U.S. Department of Justice
persons.context: The author of the forwarded email, who received a call from the House Oversight Committee regarding the Jeffrey Epstein indictment and is seeking the correct point of contact within the DOJ to handle the request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment that prompted the House Oversight Committee to contact the Department of Justice.

events.title: House Oversight Committee Contact
events.description: The House Oversight Committee contacted the Department of Justice's Office of Legislative Affairs regarding the Jeffrey Epstein indictment.

events.title: Internal DOJ Email Chain
events.description: An internal email was forwarded within the DOJ concerning how to respond to the House Oversight Committee's inquiry about the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The House Oversight Committee contacted the U.S. Department of Justice regarding the Jeffrey Epstein indictment in July 2019.
The contact was directed to the DOJ's Office of Legislative Affairs, specifically a Deputy Assistant Attorney General.
The email indicates internal coordination within the DOJ to identify the correct team to handle the congressional request.
The document shows congressional interest in the Epstein case shortly after his July 2019 indictment.
